posts.name: Mike Stitt
posts.cooked: Hi, We the spires FRC9106 are trying to use both solidworks desktop and and online (because we don’t have many CAD capable laptops, and solidworks rather than onshape because our mentors know solidworks). We think we signed up for both, but are very confused, because we can’t seem to get to the online version of solidworks and are not getting responses from emails to: Support.3DSEdu@3ds.com .  Is there a way to get to a person to get support?  -Thanks! -Mike

link_counts.title: Change one letter of a thread title

posts.name: David Powers
posts.cooked:
stittrm:

our mentors know solidworks

Just a note, have them do the Onshape fundamentals courses, if they are proficient at SolidWorks, it’ll take less than a week to get up to speed and pay substantial dividends in the future for your program.

Onshape is by and far the obvious choice for FRC at this point, rip the bandaid off. Their support is great and the featurescripts are incredibly powerful, tools like MKCAD and the such make it a great tool to get the students from 0-1.

Onshape4frc.com can get you started.

@Drew_B please just send my check to the 6328 Venmo, thanks

posts.name: Noah Stricker
posts.cooked: Hi, I don’t know much about the web version of SolidWorks, but If you want online functionality, I would recommend using Onshape. Coming from a previous SolidWorks team who is switching to Onshape and someone who is fairly experienced in both, they both have quite a bit of overlap and it is not too difficult for someone with solidworks experience to figure out onshape.

posts.name: Quinn R-B
posts.cooked: Additionally frcdesign.org is a great teaching/learning tool.

posts.name: EricH
posts.cooked:
Guys, they’re asking for Solidworks help, not Onshape evangelism. While the responses of “just do Onshape” are correct, you didn’t need 3 of them, and it’s not what they’re asking for.

@mplanchard , this sounds like something you might be able to help with?

posts.name: Troy Dietz
posts.cooked:
You’re talking about xDesign, right?

3DExperience modeling is mostly just Solidworks desktop with some cloud PDM baked in and an anti-consumer licensing scheme - it’s still installed on your computer and requires Windows.

xDesign (which is nestled inside 3DExperience iirc?) is the cloud-based modeling system that runs from a web browser, allowing for lower system requierments. It has an appreciably different user interface and would likely have a similar learning curve to [ducks] switching to OnShape. Felt like something between OnShape and Fusion360 when I tried it a year or so ago.

Anyway, I think @mplanchard is usually the one helping folks out here and does a great job so I will stop dissing Dassault Systèmes’s recent business decisions.

posts.name: Marie Planchard
posts.cooked:
There are three offers to all FIRST team.

1 SOLIDWORKS that runs on your PC

2 SOLIDWORKS CLOUD apps. 100% browser based. Different interface but teams use to design a robot and more.  I runs on a tablet or Mac. PC.  Or chrome book. No install.

3 SOLIDWORKS + cloud services. Your solidworks models are stored and shared through cloud.

Www.solidworks.com/ FIRST .

Let me know no if you need help. Marie

posts.name: bohdand
posts.cooked:
@mplanchard Thanks for that simple comparison of the options - I was not able to get a clear understanding of that on your website.

I am looking for the same solution as @stittrm for our team. We are looking for online for basic CAD but also the Electrical and CAM for the local install version, but want to have but both users accessing the same cloud storage so they can all collaborate on the same files. Does this option exist?

I can’t figure out what the 3DEXPERIENCE Engineer part of SOLIDWORKS Desktop + 3DEXPERIENCE Engineer provides. Is this the student learning community?

Thanks for any help.

Bohdan - Team 1099 Mentor

posts.name: Espino
posts.cooked: I think it is faster that you sign up again for the license, they give you the code in one or two days. Just check that you ask for both versions, it’s the same form, but if you ask for both versions in the sponsorship offer, you will be asked to send an excel with your students declarations and consents.

posts.name: Mike Stitt
posts.cooked:
Keep good track of the email addresses you submit at what times for which students/mentors.

Keeping track of who you submitted and who is fully in the system is difficult.

posts.name: Marie Planchard
posts.cooked:
Go to SOLIDWORKS.com/ FIRST

Select SOLIDWORKS+ cloud storage

With SOLIDWORKS you will get 3D  CAD,  Electrical - 2D layout and 3D wire harness, and SOLIDWORKS CAM. 1 install for windows PC.

You will also get cloud services that will give you cloud storage.

We are not offering 3DEXPERIENCE Engineer at this time to FIRST teams.

Regards. Marie

posts.name: bohdand
posts.cooked:
Thanks Marie.

Does that mean that SOLIDWORKS Desktop and SOLIDWORKS Cloud Apps with collaboration cannot be combined at this time?

Thanks - Bohdan

posts.name: Stephen Kalogiannis
posts.cooked:
Old post, but I am interested in hearing “why On-shape is by far the obvious choice for FRC .”  in your opinion. It is far from industry standard. Would it not be better to familiarize students with current industry standards, so that they have a leg up in design when they enter the work force.

I work for a multinational machine manufacturing company and on shape would never been considered even in the slightest for use in design.

posts.name: David Powers
posts.cooked:
sk2983:

far from industry standard

Not so sure this is true anymore. I was at Formlabs for a while, we used it with great success for all printers and accessories.

We currently use it at the company I’m at now, Reframe Systems, . We use it for both robot microfactories hardware development as well as modeling all of our homes. Featurescripting your workflows is the future, there’s no question about that. It’s only getting better every day.

Aside from that, there is something to be said about using the accessible, simple tool as an intro for our students to get started in hardware design. That makes it the obvious choice for FRC . IMO the switch from one CAD software to another is trivial, but going from 0-1 is not. Utilizing the simpler tool to get kids off the ground is a smart path, and with so many resources from the community, we can get kids from logging in the first time to creating working subsystems in days and weeks, not months like we’ve seen with other CAD software.

There are plenty of multinational machine manufacturing companies that utilize Onshape.

posts.name: Marie Planchard
posts.cooked: You need to apply for both. The middle one - cloud apps and the third one SOLIDWORKS plus cloud storage

posts.name: Matthew Clegg
posts.cooked:
Hi folks, I lead the SOLIDWORKS Champions Program here at SOLIDWORKS, and work with Dan Wagner, who leads the SOLIDWORKS User Group Network ( SWUGN ) worldwide.

The official way to submit student support requests is through this link . You will need to create a login, if you don’t have one already. image 1580×448 37.1 KB

image 1580×448 37.1 KB

image 1580×448 37.1 KB

Additionally, we have two more ways to help all of you with SOLIDWORKS:

Our SOLIDWORKS Champions are our 400 most passionate and expert SOLIDWORKS users from over 40 countries, and I’ve invited them to engage FIRST teams in this forum to help answer questions about how to use SOLIDWORKS, design intent, best-practices, etc.

Our SOLIDWORKS Champions are our 400 most passionate and expert SOLIDWORKS users from over 40 countries, and I’ve invited them to engage FIRST teams in this forum to help answer questions about how to use SOLIDWORKS, design intent, best-practices, etc.

Please visit SWUGN.org and locate a SOLIDWORKS User Group (SWUG) near you (or anywhere in the world if you prefer a virtual experience). I can personally attest to the deep well of knowledge within SWUGN, as I attended countless meetings over my 10 year career as a manufacturing engineer. This community helped me train for my job, find new/better jobs, prepare for SOLIDWORKS Certifications like the CSWP/E, and form lifelong friendships.

Please visit SWUGN.org and locate a SOLIDWORKS User Group (SWUG) near you (or anywhere in the world if you prefer a virtual experience). I can personally attest to the deep well of knowledge within SWUGN, as I attended countless meetings over my 10 year career as a manufacturing engineer. This community helped me train for my job, find new/better jobs, prepare for SOLIDWORKS Certifications like the CSWP/E, and form lifelong friendships.

On behalf of over 7 million SOLIDWORKS users worldwide, welcome to the community of passionate designers, engineers, makers, and everyone in-between. We’re glad you’re here

Cheers, Matthew Clegg SOLIDWORKS Community and User Advocacy

posts.name: Gaurab Chatterjee
posts.cooked:
Hi First Teams!

Following our fearless leader @MatthewClegg , I wanted to express my support for the first teams. My name is Gaurab Chatterjee, and I’m an R&D Engineer in the medical device field. I have extensive experience with SolidWorks, holding both a CSWE certification and the title of SolidWorks Champion .

If anyone needs SolidWorks assistance, please don’t hesitate to reach out to me via the forums. I’m happy to help.

Best regards,

Gaurab Chatterjee SolidWorks Champion, CSWE

posts.name: Josh Mayes, CSWE
posts.cooked:
Hello all, Josh Mayes here, following on the responses from @MatthewClegg and ChatterG and echoing Gaurab’s offer for help with SOLIDWORKS support. @mplanchard is the right person for the official licensing help, but myself and other SOLIDWORKS Champions do this as volunteers, not DS employees.  We are passionate fellow users who want to help grow and inspire the next generation of designers and engineers to better utilize and value the tools we have all come to love and depend upon for our work and careers! Please reach out via DM or tag me in a post if there’s any CAD challenges I may be able to assist your team with.

Best regards,

Josh Mayes, CSWE, CPAP SOLIDWORKS Champion MVSWUG Co-leader

posts.name: Gaurav Patil
posts.cooked:
Hi FIRST Teams!

Following the guidance of our SOLIDWORKS community leader @MatthewClegg , I wanted to share my support for all the inspiring FIRST teams out there!

My name is Gaurav Patil , and I’m a Mechanical Design Engineer with strong expertise in SOLIDWORKS , holding the CSWP certification and proudly serving as a SOLIDWORKS Champion and Leader of the Aurangabad SOLIDWORKS User Group (AU-SWUG) .

If you need any help with SOLIDWORKS be it 3D modeling, assemblies, drawings, rendering, or best design practices please feel free to reach out to me here on the forums. I’d be more than happy to support you in your design journey.

Looking forward to helping you build something great!

Best regards, Gaurav Patil SOLIDWORKS Champion | CSWP | AU-SWUG Leader

posts.name: Nate Laverdure (he/him)
posts.cooked: Solidworks Champions: Welcome to the forum and thanks for offering your help and expertise! Offering your 1-on-1 assistance is generous and appreciated, but please keep in mind the guidance in our FAQ with regards to direct messaging between adults and students.
